title: Euler’s Identity
description:
Euler’s identity connects five fundamental mathematical constants (e, i, π, 1, 0)
in a single elegant equation, often called the most beautiful formula in mathematics.
use_cases: Signal processing: Foundation of Fourier analysis and phasor representation
Quantum mechanics: Complex exponentials describe wave functions
Electrical engineering: AC circuit analysis using complex impedance

constants.description: Euler’s number ≈ 2.71828, base of the natural logarithm
Pi ≈ 3.14159, ratio of circumference to diameter
